thread.title: Cleveland Cavaliers' Anderson Varejao talks about his health heading into the opener and early-season expectations (video)
thread.title_full: Cleveland Cavaliers' Anderson Varejao talks about his health heading into the opener and early-season expectations (video) | cleveland.com

author: Chris Fedor, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Cleveland Cavaliers' Anderson Varejao talks about his health heading into the opener and early-season expectations (video)
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- When Cleveland Cavaliers forward Anderson Varejao takes the court on Oct. 27 against the Chicago Bulls, it will be his first regular season game since suffering a season-ending torn Achilles last December.
Varejao is ready, feeling good after playing six of the team's seven preseason games. But some of his other teammates aren't as lucky.
The Cavaliers will begin the season without star point guard Kyrie Irving and defensive menace Iman Shumpert, who will miss the first three months following wrist surgery.
Following Wednesday's practice, Varejao talked about the challenges of starting the season shorthanded and whether he feels the on-court chemistry is where it needs to be. Varejao also gave an update on his health heading into the opener and whether he was surprised about his level of activity during the preseason.
